newsitem.title: USA: California budget negotiators report some progress.
newsitem.headline: California budget negotiators report some progress.

text.p: California Gov. Pete Wilson and legislative leaders have made some progress in negotiations to end the state's budget impasse, a spokesman for the governor said Thursday.
"They're making progress," particularly on welfare reform legislation, Wilson spokesman Ron Low said. He declined to elaborate.
Other state officials said they do not expect a final budget agreement to be reached this week.
Welfare reform has been a major stumbling block for lawmakers who continue to negotiate the state budget for the 1997-1998 fiscal year, which began July 1.
The state's Constitutional budget deadline was June 15.
Wilson, a Republican, has scheduled budget talks late Thursday with legislative leaders.
